intro: Silene cryptantha, commonly known as the cryptantha catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Silene cryptantha has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators. It is a perennial plant that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
